info.name: 3. Notification Service API - Complete Collection
info.description:
Comprehensive Postman collection for Notification Service API based on entity models and seed templates from V2__seed_templates.sql.

**Key Features:**
- Multi-channel notification support (SMS, Email, WhatsApp, In-App)
- Template-based notifications with dynamic placeholder substitution
- All 181 templates from seed data included
- Organized by channel, project type, and entity
- Compliant with NotificationRequest DTO structure
- All requests include example responses

**Request Structure (NotificationRequest DTO):**
- `channel`: SMS, WHATSAPP, EMAIL, or INAPP (required)
- `templateCode`: Template code from seed data (required)
- `mobile`: Mobile number for SMS/WhatsApp (required for SMS/WhatsApp)
- `email`: Email address for EMAIL (required for EMAIL)
- `username`: Username for personalization (optional, recommended)
- `userId`: User ID for audit/logging (optional)
- `subject`: Subject/title (optional, for EMAIL/INAPP)
- `placeholders`: Map of template variables (required)

**Environment Variables Required:**
- notificationbaseUrl: Base URL (default: http://localhost:8082)
- accessToken: JWT Bearer token from auth-service
- projectType: Project type (ASSET_MGMT or ECOM)
- Various entity-specific variables (assetId, assetName, categoryName, etc.)
- Recipient variables (mobile, email, userId, username)
- Common variables (otp, name, orderId, errorCode, timestamp, etc.)

header.description: JWT Bearer token from auth-service. The token is used to extract userId for filtering notifications.

query.description: Number of days to retrieve notifications (optional). If not provided, uses configured default (30 days).

request.description:
Get notification list for the logged-in user.

**Authentication:**
- Requires Authorization header with Bearer token
- Automatically extracts userId from JWT token
- Returns only in-app notifications for the logged-in user

**Query Parameters:**
- `days` (optional): Number of days to retrieve notifications. If not provided, uses configured default from `application.yml` (notification.list.display-days, default: 30 days)

**Response includes:**
- `id`: Notification ID
- `userId`: User ID
- `username`: Username
- `title`: Notification title
- `message`: Notification message (rendered with placeholders)
- `templateCode`: Template code used
- `createdAt`: Creation timestamp
- `read`: Read status (default: false)
- `priority`: Priority level (if available)

**Response Example:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Notifications retrieved successfully",
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 123,
      "userId": "456",
      "username": "john.doe",
      "title": "Asset Created",
      "message": "Asset Laptop-001 has been created successfully",
      "templateCode": "ASSET_CREATED_INAPP",
      "createdAt": "2024-01-15T10:30:00",
      "read": false,
      "priority": null
    },
    {
      "id": 122,
      "userId": "456",
      "username": "john.doe",
      "title": "Warranty Expiring",
      "message": "Warranty for Asset Laptop-001 is expiring in 15 days",
      "templateCode": "WARRANTY_EXPIRING_INAPP",
      "createdAt": "2024-01-14T09:20:00",
      "read": false,
      "priority": null
    }
  ]
}
```

**Configuration:**
- Default display days: Configured in `application.yml` as `notification.list.display-days` (default: 30)
- Max results: Configured in `application.yml` as `notification.list.max-results` (default: 100)

**Use Cases:**
- Display notifications in notification icon/dropdown
- Show recent activity to users
- Notification center/feed

query.description: Number of days to count notifications (optional). If not provided, uses configured default (30 days).

request.description:
Get notification count for the logged-in user (for badge display).

**Authentication:**
- Requires Authorization header with Bearer token
- Automatically extracts userId from JWT token
- Returns count of in-app notifications for the logged-in user

**Query Parameters:**
- `days` (optional): Number of days to count notifications. If not provided, uses configured default from `application.yml` (notification.list.display-days, default: 30 days)

**Response Example:**
```json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Notification count retrieved successfully",
  "data": {
    "userId": "456",
    "count": 5,
    "days": 30
  }
}
```

**Use Cases:**
- Display notification badge count on notification icon
- Show unread notification count
- Quick notification status check

item.name: Get Notification List by User ID (Path Parameter)

query.description: Number of days to retrieve notifications (optional). If not provided, uses configured default (30 days).

request.description:
Get notification list for a specific user by userId (path parameter).

**Authentication:**
- Requires Authorization header with Bearer token

**Path Parameters:**
- `userId`: User ID to get notifications for (required)

**Query Parameters:**
- `days` (optional): Number of days to retrieve notifications. If not provided, uses configured default from `application.yml` (notification.list.display-days, default: 30 days)

**Response:**
Same structure as Get Notification List

**Example:**
```
GET /api/notifications/list/123?days=30
```
